reviewText: Ernie and the boys go above and beyond to delight and entertain with this DVD concert. Great gospel songs sung by a great quartet.
Title: Oh What a Savior

reviewText: Yes, I enojoy the DVD; however The Tribute to the Cathedrials is better, I think.  I am sure that not everyone agrees with me, but this is my turn, right?As for the newer base singer, he sounds very good with the group.I think it is a good production.
Title: Oh What a Savior

reviewText: I am not good with change and I was pretty sure to not like EHSS without Ryan and Tim. But............. that new bass is absolutely amazing. The performances seemed sincere and fun. And the lead did an amazing performance on 'Noah Found Grace'. 'Glorious Day' the remake of 'One Day' is EXCELLENT. This may be the best yet!
Title: Oh What a Savior

reviewText: Oh What a Savior was eagerly awaited in our house.  Filmed before a live audience in Paducah Kentucky, people came from 21 states.  Signature Sound starts the concert with When the Saints Go Marching In followed by Heavenly Parade.  Then Ernie sings a solo, "Walk with Me." This song has always been one of my favorites.  If you don't know the song a few bars should help.  "Walk with me, walk with me lest your eyes no longer see; all the glory all the story of his love."Without spoiling the concert for you I will just make a few notes.  J. Mark McVey sings Climb Every Mountain.  At times he and Ernie sing together.  It is a thrilling performance. Wayne Haun sings Blue Again (I will let you hear it without commentary)  Wesley Pritchard, a versatile musician from Gaither Homecoming also brings his talent to the concert singing several songs with the Group.  There is one other group - Beyond the Ashes who sing "Peace in the midst of the Storm."  I had never heard them before but they are excellent.Closing the dvd is "Oh What A Savior"  This was sung by Rosie Rozell for all the days Rosie sang with various groups.  I remember as a teenager having an album with Oh What A Savior and Rosie Rozell singing it.  It was his signature song and picked up by the Cathedrals and sung by Ernie Haase who effortlessly sings the high notes of this wonderful song.This concert will make you laugh, make you cry, have you praise the Lord and be something you will never forgetENJOY
summary: OH WHAT A SAVIOR - ERNIE HAASE & SIGNATURE SOUND
Title: Oh What a Savior

reviewText: THIS IS ANOTHER POLISHED PERFORMANCE BY ERNIE AND HIS TEAMA FEW CLICKY BITS TOWARDS THE END WHICH WAS A BIT DISAPPOINTINGI PARTICULARLY LIKED THE NEW BASSTREVOR B
